title: Cycling Marketing Board launched to promote and diversify cycling
content:
Will Strickson
20 Jan 2021

Backed by Britain's biggest bike brands, the board will run campaigns to get new people involved and diversify cycling's image

A new Cycling Marketing Board has been set up to build and diversify cycling's consumers in Britain.

Coordinated by cycling and active travel communications agency Fusion Media, the board will run major advertising campaigns and work on advocacy initiatives to help the 'interested but concerned' group who would cycle if there were a shift in infrastructure and culture.

It follows the successful #BikeIsBest campaign from the same group last year which saw the industry come together to encourage more people to ditch public and motor transport for their bike and was seen by over 30 million people.

#BikeIsBest was also behind the investigation that showed a recently-closed cycle lane was being blocked by parked cars up to 80% of the time and will use the same technology to help grassroots groups.

Founding partners of the Cycling Marketing Board include Brompton Bicycle, Cyclescheme, Komoot, Le Col, Madison, Muc-Off, Raleigh, Schwalbe UK, Sigma Sports, Specialized UK, Trek, Upgrade, Wahoo, Zwift and more.

It's also supported by Cycling UK, Sustrans, British Cycling, London Cycling Campaign, The Association of Cycle Traders (ACT), The Bikeability Trust and Wheels for Wellbeing.

CEO of Fusion Media and founder of the Cycling Marketing Board Adam Tranter said: 'Many things need to happen to secure a cycling revolution in this country and we feel our very public advertising campaigns and advocacy work can have a significant role to play.

'We welcome brands who want to get involved and support the board's efforts to get in touch; together we have the best chance of achieving long-term growth and success for cycling.

'It will benefit not only the industry but help improve our health and happiness and tackle air pollution, climate chance and inactivity.'
